titlestmt.titleproper: David Leeming Collection of James Baldwin Research
titlestmt.author: Molly Wheeler

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday February 15, 2019 at 04:03

did.unittitle: David Leeming Collection of James Baldwin Research

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 1-8 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into four series: I. Audiocassettes, II. Videocassettes, III. Photographs, IV. Other Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers contain audiocassettes, videocassettes, photographs, correspondence, and printed material related to David Leeming's biography of James Baldwin, James Baldwin: A Biography . The audiocassettes contain interviews with various family, friends, and colleagues of James Baldwin and his close friend and mentor, Beauford Delaney. The videocassettes contain television programs and an anthology of films on Baldwin. The photographs depict portraits of Baldwin and snapshots of Baldwin alone and with friends in his Saint-Paul-de-Vence residence and at other locations. Other Papers includes correspondence regarding Leeming's research and permissions for his biography on Baldwin, James Baldwin's autograph signature, and two published books by Leeming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Leeming, born February 26, 1937 in Peekskill, New York. Leeming is professor emeritus of English and comparative literature at the University of Connecticut. He wrote James Baldwin: A Biography and Amazing Grace: A Life of Beauford Delaney .

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from David Leeming on the Sinclair Lewis Fund, October 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: David Leeming Collection of James Baldwin Research. James Weldon Johnson Collection in the Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 1-4 (audiocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by individual interviewed by David Leeming and audiocassette labels assigned by Leeming. The groupings Friends of James Baldwin in Turkey and Friends of Beauford Delaney were established by Leeming.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Titles contained in quotations were supplied by David Leeming.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Taped in the Atelier Charles Biggs 5, Cite Falguiere with T'Ang, Phillipe Briet, Charles Boggs. Note for David Leeming: I met T'Ang (Hay Wen) the Chinese Painter, in Paris in 1951. We were friends, then, for 40 years. And I introduced him to Beauford early on. T'Ang died of AIDS about 8 months after this tape was made, he died in hospital 26 September 1991. He was 60 years old. - Charles Boggs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes fragments of interviews with Baldwin's longtime partner Lucien Happersberger with comments from Baldwin's housekeeper in France, Valerie Sordello.

unittitle.title: The James Baldwin Anthology, A Claire Bruch Film

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a commercial videocassette. It has not been digitized.
